div1.head: Letter from Enrique Cervantes to Philip Showalter Hench, January 2, 1942
div1.opener:
AMERICA CLINICA
Editorial & Business Office
THE NEW YORK ACADEMY OF MEDICINE
2 E. 103RD STREET, NEW YORK, N. Y.
ATWATER 9-4700
January 2, 1942
DR. ENRIQUE J. CERVANTES, Editor
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I have just received your kind let-
ter of December 31st.

Thank you exceedingly for your offer
to send copies of “Medicas” to General Kean, General Truby
and the others. In accordance with your request, I am
forwarding twelve additional copies under separate cover.

It is indeed good of you to send the
reprint on gout and also the abstract which you mention.
Your gracious help is greatly appreciated by us. I note
from your letter that you would like the reprint on gout
returned to you and I shall be glad to do this as soon as
possible.

May I add that I read with keen in-
terest the report of your talk: “Conquerors of Yellow
Fever”, printed in the bulletin of the Proceedings of the
Staff Meetings of the Mayo Clinic of December 10, 1941.
I thoroughly enjoyed this article, it was most interest-
ing and informative.

Believe me, I felt myself very unfor-
tunate and regretted extremely that I could not get in
touch with you in time to obtain permission for reprint-
ing your paper which appeared in “Hygeia” in our November
issue of “Medicas”.

Thanking you once again for your many
courtesies and fine cooperation, I wish to remain
div1.closer:
Most sincerely yours, Dr. Enrique Cervantes
Editor EC/md
